Pre-Game Insights: Wales will commence a new era in its football journey with the appointment of Craig Bellamy as the head coach.
Turkey was the surprise of the summer, going all the way to the quarter-finals of the European Championship, delivering several impressive displays.
Coach, Vincenzo Montella has been able to frame a perfect blend of youth and experience in his camp.
Wales will have to deal with the massive absence of Daniel James, who had to leave the national team camp due to a hamstring injury.
Vincenzo Montella is expected to continue with his hybrid 5-4-1 system which can modify to a three-at-the-back in possession.
Baris Yilmaz will lead the line as the target man and will be supported by Kenan Yildiz and Arda Guler on either side.
Set-pieces will be a great weapon for Turkey against Wales due to the superior physicality in its ranks.
Turkey will start as the slight favourites but the Welsh threat cannot be overlooked.
It will certainly be an exciting watch for the fans since the hosts have not scored in their last three matches while the visitors have failed to keep a clean sheet in six games.
Wales has managed a solitary victory along with four draws and a defeat in the last six matches.
Turkey has witnessed the rise of numerous talents over the summer who will now have another chance to settle in better at the international level.
Turkey will be confident to finish the group at the top which also includes Iceland and Montenegro.
Wales failed to qualify for the Euros in Germany and will now look to bounce back on a positive note.
Coach, Craig Bellamy has confirmed in his recent press conferences that Aaron Ramsey will be included in his squad and will also serve as the captain.
The former Juventus midfielder will be a key piece owing to his time at the top.
Turkey is expected to dominate the game against Wales but can also expect quality chances at its goal from the Welsh.
One of the biggest reasons for the Turkish success at the Euros was its goalkeeper, Mert Günok.
The 35-year-old who plays for Besiktas in the Süper Lig delivered a quite outstanding shot-stopping display.
His incredible last-minute save against Austria in the round of 16 was voted by many as the moment of the tournament.
Turkey will be confident to negate the Welsh hurdle with enough quality accompanied by a strong bench as well.
If Turkey can find the top gear from the start it can get pretty worse for the hosts.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The last outing between the two sides occurred in late 2023 at the Euro Qualifiers. The nations played out a 1-1 draw which ultimately proved detrimental to the Welsh qualification journey.
Wales and Turkey have been frequent opponents over the years.

The last five H2H results are: Wales 1-1 Turkey (2023. Euro Qualifiers), Turkey 2-0 Wales (2023, Euro Qualifiers), Turkey 0-2 Wales (2021, Euros), Turkey 6-4 Wales (1997, World Cup Qualifiers), Wales 0-0 Turkey (1996, World Cup Qualifiers).
The Real Madrid youngster was sensational at the European Championship, scoring a goal whilst also providing two assists.
Arda Guler had a troublesome 2023 due to injury woes but has been on a remarkable run in 2024.
Although his minutes have been limited with his club this season, Montella will not sacrifice his starting position in the eleven.
Arda Guler will also be a handful from set pieces thanks to his wonderful left foot.
